name = 'api'

api.models module

api.permissions module

Custom API permission classes for Django REST Framework.

Includes: - IsReader: Grants access only to authenticated users with the ‘reader’ role.

class api.permissions.IsReader[source]

Bases: BasePermission

Permission class to allow only authenticated readers.

Usage:

Add to a DRF view’s permission_classes list to restrict access to readers.

Example

from .permissions import IsReader

class ArticleListView(APIView):

permission_classes = [IsReader]

has_permission(request, view)[source]

Check if the user is authenticated and has the role ‘reader’.

Parameters:

  • request – DRF Request object.

  • view – DRF View object.

Returns:

True if user is authenticated and is a reader, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

api.serializers module

Serializers for the News application API.

Includes: - ArticleSerializer: Serializes Article objects for API responses. - MySubscriptionsSerializer: Serializes a reader’s subscriptions (publishers and journalists).

class api.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for the Article model.

Fields:

  • made_by_journalist: The username of the journalist who created the article (read-only).

  • title: Article title.

  • content: Article content.

  • is_independant: Boolean indicating if article is independent.

  • publisher: Publisher name (read-only).

  • is_approved: Boolean indicating if the article is approved by an editor.

  • created_at: Timestamp of article creation.

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

fields = ['made_by_journalist', 'title', 'content', 'is_independant', 'publisher', 'is_approved', 'created_at']
model

alias of Article

class api.serializers.MySubscriptionsSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for a reader’s subscriptions.

Provides a read-only view of the user’s subscribed journalists and publishers.

Fields:

  • reader_journalist_subscriptions: List of usernames of subscribed journalists.

  • reader_publisher_subscriptions: List of names of subscribed publishers.

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

fields = ['reader_journalist_subscriptions', 'reader_publisher_subscriptions']
model

alias of CustomUser

api.urls module

api.views module

API views for the News application.

Includes: - ArticleListAPIView: Provides a list of approved articles accessible to the authenticated reader. - MySubscriptionListAPIView: Provides a reader’s current subscriptions (publishers and journalists).

Permissions: - Only authenticated users with the role ‘reader’ can access these endpoints.

class api.views.ArticleListAPIView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ListAPIView

API endpoint that returns a list of approved articles available to the reader.

The queryset filters:

  • Non-independent articles published by publishers the reader is subscribed to.

  • Independent articles made by journalists the reader is subscribed to.

get_queryset()[source]

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>, <class 'api.permissions.IsReader'>]
serializer_class

alias of ArticleSerializer

class api.views.MySubscriptionListAPIVIew(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ListAPIView

API endpoint that returns the subscriptions of the authenticated reader.

Returns:

List of usernames of subscribed journalists. - reader_publisher_subscriptions: List of names of subscribed publishers.

Return type:

  • reader_journalist_subscriptions

get_queryset()[source]

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>, <class 'api.permissions.IsReader'>]
